title: Create Game Concept
purpose: Define, validate, and package the initial game concept, anchored to the Entertainment Standards exported by E1.
guardrails: Game concept must **inherit** and remain consistent with E1’s approved variables (premise, tone, primary characters/world cues).
Any deviation from E1 requires written rationale and notification to Entertainment.

tasks.title: Conduct Market & Genre Analysis
tasks.description: Analyze competitor games and market trends to identify strengths, weaknesses, gaps, and opportunities. Compile research summarizing at least five comparable titles and outline target audience segments.

deliverables.description: Comprehensive market analysis report comparing five competitor games, mapping strengths and weaknesses, identifying market gaps, and outlining target audience segments.

acceptance.text: Includes at least five comparable games with analysis of strengths, weaknesses, and market gaps.
Identifies primary and secondary target audience segments with supporting data.
Cites sources for market data and competitor profiles.

tasks.title: Define Player Personas & Experience Goals
tasks.description: Develop detailed player personas and define the intended experience goals to ensure the game resonates with target audiences.

deliverables.description: Profiles of at least three archetypal players representing different demographics, playstyles, motivations, and pain points.

acceptance.text: Contains at least three distinct persona profiles with demographics, motivations, and frustrations.
Each profile links to market segment data from the market analysis.
Approved by game design and marketing leads.

deliverables.description: Document summarizing desired player experiences and emotional outcomes, aligning them with core mechanics and creative pillars.

acceptance.text: Lists key experience goals and emotional beats aligned with player personas.
Defines measurable success criteria for each experience goal.
Reviewed and approved by creative lead.

tasks.title: Establish Core Gameplay Loop & Creative Pillars
tasks.description: Define the fundamental gameplay loop and articulate the creative pillars that will guide art, design, and narrative decisions.

deliverables.description: Diagram of the core gameplay loop accompanied by narrative text explaining each step and a set of creative pillars with rationale linking them to player value and brand identity.

acceptance.text: Provides a clear diagram of the core gameplay loop with inputs, actions, feedback, and rewards.
Lists at least three creative pillars with descriptions and rationale.
Demonstrates how each pillar supports the player experience goals and E1 variables.

tasks.title: Identify Risks & Feasibility Concerns
tasks.description: Systematically identify potential risks and feasibility concerns, then assign ownership and mitigation strategies.

deliverables.description: Matrix capturing identified risks across gameplay, technical, art, and schedule dimensions with mitigations and probability/impact ratings.

acceptance.text: Lists risks in categories (gameplay, technical, art, schedule) with probability and impact scores.
Provides mitigation strategies and contingency plans for each risk.
Reviewed by cross-disciplinary leads and updated regularly.

deliverables.description: Spreadsheet mapping each identified risk to a responsible owner and timeframe for mitigation.

acceptance.text: Every risk has an assigned owner and target resolution date.
Owners acknowledged and commit to mitigation plans.
Spreadsheet stored in shared project drive.

tasks.title: Create Greenlight Packet
tasks.description: Package all concept phase artifacts into a greenlight packet for executive review and decision-making.

deliverables.description: Concise one-page summary of the game concept, vision, target market, core loop, and differentiators.

acceptance.text: Summarizes the concept, vision, target market, core loop, and differentiators in one page.
Written in clear, persuasive language suitable for executives.
Approved by product and creative leads.

deliverables.description: Lightweight slide deck (10–15 slides) conveying the game's vision, market analysis, personas, core loop, creative pillars, and risk overview.

acceptance.text: Contains 10–15 slides covering concept, market analysis, personas, core loop, creative pillars, and risks.
Consistent visual design aligned with the brand.
Reviewed and approved by leadership.

deliverables.description: Manifest linking to all artifacts generated during the concept phase with descriptions, versions, and storage paths.

acceptance.text: List includes all generated artifacts with filenames, descriptions, versions, and storage paths.
Manifest kept up-to-date and accessible to stakeholders.
Cross-checked against actual file repository.
